channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Built on a rich coffee history, Yemeni cafes find U.S. success and new challenges, too
item.description: Yemen is an ancient birthplace of the coffee trade, and immigrants fleeing its civil war have brought their culture here in the form of cafes. Hundreds of Yemeni coffee shops have opened in the U.S.
item.content:encoded: Yemen is an ancient birthplace of the coffee trade, and immigrants fleeing its civil war have brought their culture here in the form of cafes. Hundreds of Yemeni coffee shops have opened in the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Neda Ulaby

item.title: Opinion: Pope Francis's sympathy for migrants was personal
item.description: Pope Francis often spoke with great sympathy for immigrants and refugees. NPR's Scott Simon reminds us that the Pope's father fled Mussolini's Italy, immigrating to Argentina.
item.content:encoded:
Pope Francis often spoke with great sympathy for immigrants and refugees. NPR's Scott Simon reminds us that the Pope's father fled Mussolini's Italy, immigrating to Argentina.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: Trump meets Zelenskyy during visit to Pope Francis' funeral
item.description: The White House says it will release more details of the meeting, which it described as "a very productive discussion."
item.content:encoded:
The White House says it will release more details of the meeting, which it described as "a very productive discussion."

(Image credit: Ukrainian Presidential Press Office)
item.dc:creator: Deepa Shivaram

item.title: Photos: Pope Francis is laid to rest and mourned around the world
item.description: Pope Francis was honored with a funeral Mass Saturday morning in the Vatican City's St. Peter's Square. These are some of the images that captured the grief of those mourning him around the world.
item.content:encoded:
Pope Francis was honored with a funeral Mass Saturday morning in the Vatican City's St. Peter's Square. These are some of the images that captured the grief of those mourning him around the world.

(Image credit: Kai Pfaffenbach)
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff

item.title: These Australian twins have gone viral after speaking in synch
item.description: Meet Bridgette and Paula Powers, identical twins who speak in synch and dedicate themselves to animal conservation.
item.content:encoded:
Meet Bridgette and Paula Powers, identical twins who speak in synch and dedicate themselves to animal conservation.

(Image credit: Screenshot via YouTube)
item.dc:creator: Manuela LÃ³pez Restrepo

item.title: Employee cuts at Social Security are leaving remaining workers struggling to keep up
item.description: Social Security employees are feeling "overwhelmed" and wait times for phone services are up as workforce cuts from the Trump administration are being felt throughout the agency.
item.content:encoded:
Social Security employees are feeling "overwhelmed" and wait times for phone services are up as workforce cuts from the Trump administration are being felt throughout the agency.

(Image credit: George Walker IV)
item.dc:creator: Ashley Lopez

item.title: Ten years after Freddie Gray's death, his neighborhood looks for hope
item.description: There's still a lot of need in Baltimore's Sandtown-Winchester neighborhood, where Freddie Gray lived. People from the neighborhood work to meet it.
item.content:encoded:
There's still a lot of need in Baltimore's Sandtown-Winchester neighborhood, where Freddie Gray lived. People from the neighborhood work to meet it.

(Image credit: AndrÃ© Chung for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Juana Summers

item.title: Why judges blocked the Trump admin's school DEI crackdown
item.description: On Thursday, three federal judges in Maryland, New Hampshire and Washington, D.C., said Trump's anti-DEI efforts were on shaky legal ground.
item.content:encoded:
On Thursday, three federal judges in Maryland, New Hampshire and Washington, D.C., said Trump's anti-DEI efforts were on shaky legal ground.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: Cory Turner

item.title: Crowds of mourners and dignitaries pay respects to Pope Francis at funeral service
item.description: It's a day of remembrance, mourning and celebration as thousands gather in Rome to pay their respects and say farewell to Pope Francis.
item.content:encoded:
It's a day of remembrance, mourning and celebration as thousands gather in Rome to pay their respects and say farewell to Pope Francis.

(Image credit: Antonio Masiello)
item.dc:creator: Willem Marx

item.title: Virginia Giuffre, who accused Prince Andrew in Epstein sex trafficking scandal, has died
item.description: The American-born Giuffre, who lived in Australia for years, became an advocate for sex trafficking survivors after emerging as a central figure in financier Jeffrey Epstein's prolonged downfall.
item.content:encoded:
The American-born Giuffre, who lived in Australia for years, became an advocate for sex trafficking survivors after emerging as a central figure in financier Jeffrey Epstein's prolonged downfall.

(Image credit: Bebeto Matthews)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
